result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Garman requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 3, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Authorization to Appear;  filed by Attorney Olivia Garman

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no violent contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

1:04 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Ross A Baker in court.  Attorney Binder for attorney Olivia G Garman in court for Ross A Baker. 

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
